results.title: They would elope
results.brief_description: A father tricks his daughter into eloping with her lover and then celebrates her wedding upon their return. Cast includes Billy Quirk, Mary Pickford, James Kirkwood, Kate Bruce, Mack Sennett. Silent film with no intertitles.

results.title: They used to call it sandy blight (A)
results.creator_credit: Nomad Films International and Douglas Stanley
results.brief_description: Designed to reveal the problem of trachoma and other serious eye diseases common to outback Aborigines. Health problems, housing and general living conditions are also looked at. Shows how medical attention can help to alleviate problems.

results.title: They took the children away: Aboriginal family experience
results.brief_description: Tens of thousands of Aboriginal children have been taken from their families. The removal of indigenous children has had devastating effects on the traditional family life of Aboriginal communities. Three Aboriginal people interviewed in this program talk about their own experiences in a hope to create awareness and understanding between Aboroginal and non-Aboriginal Australians.

results.title: They smell different
results.creator_credit: Panzer Productions, Anne Deveson and Suzanne Baker
results.brief_description:
This film takes a realistic look at many of the most important issues facing the migrant in their local community. Included are government policy, job opportunity, child neglect, social acceptance, lack of police protection, and intermarriage.
Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: They shoot horses don't they
results.creator_credit: Palomar Pictures, Chartoff, Winkler Production, Irwin Winkler, Robert Chartoff and Sydney Pollack
results.brief_description: The year is 1932 and it is the height of the Depression. In order to win prize money various couples sign on for a gruelling dance marathon lasting over 1,000 hours and in which they will be treated as performing animals, prodded into increasingly desparate acts in order to survive the continuous dancing. This is a stunning and deeply evocative film about a period in American history when desperation forced people into cruelty and debasement. The film features a stunning performance by Jane Fonda as the bitter survivor, Gloria, an outstanding performance by Gig Young as the cynical MC and brilliant direction by Sydney Pollack. Fonda’s performance elevated her reputation as the leading English-language actress of her generation. Faultless in script, direction and performances, “They Shoot Horses, Don’t They?” is still a remarkably moving and disquieting film.

results.title: They shoot crocodiles...don't they?
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Rebecca Scott and Rory McGuinness
results.brief_description: This documentary provides the viewer with a fascinating insight into how wildlife documentaries are able to capture such spectacular footage. The film follows a year in the life of film makers Rory McGuinness, Rebecca Scott, their daughter Bella, and camera assistant Matt Cadwallader as they set out to film crocodiles, kangaroos and other creatures that inhabit Kakadu National Park. It is revealed as a process involving patience, persistence, nervous energy, and excitement.

results.title: They served their country
results.creator_credit: Returned Sailors, Soldiers and Airmens Imperial League of Australia and Audio-Visual Aids, University of Melbourne
results.brief_description: Shows the efforts made by the RSL to keep alive the spirit of comradeship, by serving the needy, sick, and bereaved, providing for the needs of past and present servicemen and women and their dependents. Tours various RSL care facilities in and around Melbourne and Bendigo.

results.title: They reckon a woman's world's just it and a bit
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Penny Chapman and Meg Stewart
results.brief_description: Five housewives, living in a housing estate in outer Adelaide, tell how they organized a mutual self-help group to overcome the boredom, frustration and loneliness of living in suburbia.

results.title: They planted a stone
results.creator_credit: World Wide Pictures, James Carr and Robin Carruthers
results.brief_description: The story of how the immense desert of the Sudan was transformed, by the harnessing of the waters of the River Nile, into the rich country of the Gezira Cotton Scheme: how this was achieved by means of a partnership with the Sudanese people; and how they have benefited thereby.

results.title: They live again
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional and A. Reginald Dobson
results.brief_description: This film (which is a shortened version of the long film “Accident Service”, 312704) deals with the service provided for injured miners in Great Britain, in a modern hospital and rehabilitation centre in the Midlands. All stages of the treatment of their injuries, and their psyhological rehabiliation are vividly presented.
